com.spotify.sdk.android.authentication

Class SpotifyAuthentication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spotify.sdk.android.authentication.SpotifyAuthentication

  • public class SpotifyAuthentication
extends Object
    Contains helper functions to open an authentication window and to parse the response from the Spotify accounts service.

    • Method Detail

      • openAuthWindow

        public static void openAuthWindow(String clientId,
                                  String responseType,
                                  String redirectUri,
                                  String[] scopes,
                                  String state,
                                  android.app.Activity activity)
        Triggers an intent to open the Spotify accounts service in a browser. Make sure that the redirectUri is set to an URI your app is registered for in your AndroidManifest.xml. To get your clientId and to set the redirectUri, please see the my applications part of our developer site.
        Parameters:
        clientId - Your applications client id provided by my applications
        responseType - Expected response type. Should be set to either "code" or "token". You can find more information at Web API Authorization guide for what response type you would like to use.
        redirectUri - The URI your app is registered to listen to, as declared in your AndroidManifest.xml file.
        scopes - The scopes you wish to ask for. You can find out what scopes are available at Web API: Using scopes
        state - Optional. A parameter that you can use to maintain a value between the request and the callback to redirectUri. This parameter can be used to prevent cross-site request forgery (CSRF) exploits. Can be null if not needed.
        activity - The activity that should start the intent to open a browser.

      • parseOauthResponse

        public static AuthenticationResponse parseOauthResponse(android.net.Uri uri)
        Parses the URI returned from the Spotify accounts service.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI
        Returns:
        Authentication response. If parsing failed, this object will be populated with the given error codes.
